p: Escherichia coli is an important human and animal pathogens which is responsible for a serious public health concern with a significant economic burden. Avian pathogenic E. coli (APEC) causes extraintestinal infections, known as colibacillosis, which causes extensive mortality in poultry flocks with high economic losses ( 3). The pathogenicity of this bacterium is facilitated by broad range of virulence factors encoded by virulence-associated genes ( 4). One of the most important invasive factors associated with the pathogenicity of this bacterium is the ability to form biofilms ( 5).
